abstract: New York Times reporter Lizette Alvarez describes her memories and deep affection for Miami's Little Havana neighborhood, saying it has long been the center of life for city's Cuban exile community, and authentic preserve of Cuban culture; notes that many famous Cuban-Americans have come from neighborhood; wonders whether cultural treasure can be preserved in face of gentrification, development and other forces (Series: Assignment America).
lead_paragraph: The neighborhood has shaped thousands of Cuban immigrants or their children into success stories, from Marco Rubio to the rapper Pitbull. But a reporter who grew up there fears its demise.

headline.print_headline: Modern Miami Casts Covetous Eye on ‘Cuban Plymouth Rock’

snippet: The neighborhood has shaped thousands of Cuban immigrants or their children into success stories, from Marco Rubio to the rapper Pitbull. But a reporter who grew up there fears its demise.
